gurmukhi: eyk huqI duihqw iqh kI iqh soq insw supno iek pwXo ]mYn sy rUp AnUp sI mUrq so ieh ky cl mMdr AwXo ]
transliteration: Ek Houtiduhitaa Tih Kitih Sot Nisaa Soupno Ik Paayo|| Main E Roop Anoop Simoondat So Ih Ke Chal Mandar Aayo||
translation: The king had a daughter; one day she dreamt that a very beautiful prince like the god of love had come to her home;

gurmukhi: Bog kIXo iqh so imil kY ien ic`q ibKY Aiq hI suK pwXo ]cauk prI nhI pIX kib sXwm khY iqn Sok jnwXo ]2192]
transliteration: Bhog Keeyo Tih So Mil(i)kai In Chitt Bikhai At(i) Hisoukh Paayo Chaouk Parinahipeeya Pikhyo Kabi Syaam Kahai Tin Shok Janaayo||2192||
translation: She went to bed with him and was greatly gratified; she, being startled, awoke and became agitated.2192.

gurmukhi: jwgiq hI ibrlwp kIXo Aiq hI icq Sok kI bwq jnweI ]AMgn mY fgrI sI iPrY piq kI kir kY mn mY ducqweI ]
transliteration: Jaagad(i) Hibirlaap Keeyo At(i) Hichit Shok Kibaat Janaaee|| Anad Mai Dagrisiphirai Pat(i) Kikar(i) Kai Man Mai Douchtaaee||
translation: On waking up, she lamented and grew greatly afflicted in her mind; she began to feel pain in her limbs and endured dilemma in her mind regarding her husband;

gurmukhi: pRyq lgXo ikDO pRIq lgI ik kCU Ab Xw TgmUrI sI KweI ]BwKq BI sKI mokau AbY moro dY gXo pRIqm Awju idKweI ]2193]
transliteration: Pret Lagyo Kidhau Preet Lagiki Kachhodh Ab Yaa Thagmoondisikahaaee|| Bhaakhat Bhisakhimokau Abai Moro Dai Gyo Preetam Aaj(u) Dikhaaee||2193||
translation: She moved as one having been robbed; she appeared to have been possessed by some ghost; she said to her friend, “O friend ! I have seen today my beloved.”2193.

gurmukhi: eyqI hI kY bqIXw muK qy igr BU py prI sB su`D BulweI ]XO ibsMBwr prI DrnI kib sXwm BnY mno nwgn KweI ]
transliteration: Etihikai Bateeaa Moukh Te Gir Bhoo Pai Parisabh Suddh Bhulaaee|| Yau Bisanbhaar Paridharnikabi Syaam Bhanai Mano Naagad Khaaee||
translation: Saying this, she fell down on the earth and lost consciousness; she fell down unconscious on the earth as if some female serpent had stung her;

gurmukhi: mwnhu AMq smy phucXo ieh dY gXo pRIqm soq idKweI ]qau lig icqRyKw ju huqI su sKI ieh kI ieh ky iFg AweI ]2194]
transliteration: Maanoh Ant Same Pahouchyo Eh Dai Gado Pritaam Sot Dikhaaee|| Tau Lag(i) Chitdarekhaa Ju Houtisu Sakhieh Kiek Ke Dhig Aaee||2194||
translation: It appeared that she had seen her beloved in her last hour; at that time, her friend named Chitrarekha reached near her.2194.

gurmukhi: siKn dSw jb Xwih sunweI ]icqRyK qb soc jnweI ]ieh jIey jIX ho nhI mirho ]jwnm eyk so kirho ]2195]
transliteration: Sakhin Dashaa Jab Yaah(i) Sounaaee|| Chitraekh Tab Soch Janaaee|| Eh Jeee Jeeya Ho Nahimariho|| Jaanam Jatan Ek So Kariho||2195||
translation: When she described her condition to her friend, the friend also became very anxious; she thought that she would not survive then; there was then only one effort to be done.2195.

gurmukhi: jo mY nwrd so sun pwXo ]vhY jqn myry mn AwXo ]jqn Awj soaU mY kirhu ]bwnwsur qy nYku n firho ]2196]
transliteration: Jo Mai Naarad So Soun Paayo|| Vahai Jatan Dere Man Aayo|| Jatan Aaj Sooo Mai Karioh|| Baanaasur Te Naik(u) Na Darioh||2196||
translation: Whatever I have heard from Narada, the same measure has come to my mind; I shall make the same effort and shall not fear Banasura, even slightly.2196.
Speech of the friend addressed to Chitrarekha:

gurmukhi: Awqur hÍY iqh kI sKI iqh kO khXo sunwie ]jo jwnq hY jqn qUM so Ab qurqu bnwie ]2197]
transliteration: Ootur Hvai Tih Kisakhitih Kau Kahyo Sounaae|| Jo Jaanat Hai Jatan Toon So Ab Turt(u) Banaae||2197||
translation: Getting agitated, her friend said to the other friend, “Whatever you can do, do it immediately.”2197.
